qas.question: What is the name of the throne used for coronation?
What is another name for King Edward's Chair?
Upon what are kings of Scots coronated?
Who had stolen the Stone of Scone?
What is the name of the throne unused for coronation?
What isn't another name for King Edward's Chair?
Upon what are kings of Wales coronated?
Who had stolen the Stone of Stone?
Who had protected the Stone of Scone?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>King Edward's Chair<b4_0/><a0_0/> (or <a1_0><b5_0>St Edward's Chair<b5_0/><a1_0/>), the throne on which English and British sovereigns have been seated at the moment of coronation, is housed within the abbey and has been used at every coronation since 1308. From 1301 to 1996 (except for a short time in 1950 when it was temporarily stolen by <a3_0><b7_0><b8_0>Scottish nationalists<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/>), the chair also housed <a2_0>the <b6_0>Stone of Scone<b6_0/><a2_0/> upon which the kings of Scots are crowned. Although the Stone is now kept in Scotland, in Edinburgh Castle, at future coronations it is intended that the Stone will be returned to St Edward's Chair for use during the coronation ceremony.[citation needed]
